text: bill is a great guy and super friendly. he is also very helpful too and wants everyone to do well. there are bi-weekly quizzes in pollock which mostly make up your grade. there are also assignments on perusall and canvas. definitely watch the gsgs because those were extremely helpful for each quiz. instead of tophat he uses iclicker.

boyle gives a lot of room to boost your grade through homework which is nice and a group portion on the exams. i will still say this is the hardest class i have taken and the avg on exams were all 60s. he is not a great teacher though, lectures do not teach you anything and you need to have a very strong statistics background.
highly recommend taking goldstein for 106 if possible. show up to his office hours and he is willing to help out. breaks things down easy

please do not take this class with him. the content is a lot but he makes it impossible to understand. his tests are nothing like his lectures, which are useless as he talks without saying much. over that he made us buy a textbook that he created for one question in our first hw and never again. the tas are the only reason anything gets done.

she appears to be the lesser of a few evils when it comes to this vs stat 200. probably should take her as its online but she does next to nothing to actually teach. she's tenured and doesn't care lol. lock in like 2-3 days before each exam and make yourself a solid review sheet to use for the exams (open note) and it'll be manageable

this course was required for my major (bme with focus in medical imaging and devices) but i would recommend it for anyone who needs an engineering elective etc. professor is great and super approachable and the material was straight forward when it came to assignments and tests!

dr. goffe is a very very good teacher so make sure to pay attention during lectures, he goes over concepts very well and he encourages students to ask questions. the biweekly quizzes are not easy for the most part but you can prepare for them by attending the gsg quiz reviews (these are extremely helpful).

i recommend starting hw's a week in advanced! also, i recommend you treat this class not like a traditional class where you learn from the prof but more of a tutoring session, you essentially have to teach yourself the material. you would think he has no input in hw's or exams the way the material dosen't even remotely follow the lectures.
labs and projects were disorganized. textbook was expensive and never used.

great professor who was funny and shared personal stories that connected with class. the lectures were really interesting but could get long (often got out early tho). there was a good amount of reading outside of class plus having to participate in sona research. lots of extra credit though and exams were online and open-note. would take again!

one of the best professors here. pulls from the textbook for exams, so read those, and you will do well. he is very approachable and genuinely wants his students to do well. keeps lectures fast, engaging, and informative. i would definitely take his class again.

i took dr gall's course this semester, and it was great. he has a remarkable ability to make complex concepts accessible and engaging. dr gall encourages critical thinking and fosters a supportive learning environment, making every class both challenging and rewarding. a truly outstanding professor!
bill is a great guy who cares about his students. watch gsgs before every quiz.

austin boyle seemed great at first, but his class went downhill fast. he relies heavily on lectures, making attendance essential to grasp economics. his lectures are hard to follow, and the pricey course pack adds little value. his handwriting makes graphs tough to read, and grading errors were common. if you need to pass, don't take it with him.

dr. pearson is a very nice guy and understanding. overall 10/10 guy. but he is exam heavy and they are very challenging even if you study a ton. you also have to read the textbook since he uses it on his exams. there is little room to improve your grade since he only does exams and a word of the day grade (which don't do much for your grade).

dr goffe is a chill guy. hardest issue is paying attention as he has a very soft voice and a low mic volume it makes it hard to pay attention. his notes are also not very direct and relate to real world events, therefore on occasion can be hard to understand a fine cut definition. overall it was a fine class but the gsg sessions helped more.
i would love students to know, to not take this professor.

ehhh he's alright. lectures are nothing special. most of your learning will be from the las/tas. doesnt do much tbh, class itself is quite predatory on students such as selling his own textbook and breadboard catered towards assignments.

dr. boyle is a great guy. he is younger than most econ102 professors and makes you feel more level with him. your grade is heavily based on homework assignments rather than exams, which was great for me as i am not a good test taker. he has a guided notes packet that you are able to buy and fill out during lectures. highly recommend him!

god i never want to experience this course again when i am done. the lecture videos are equivalent to chinese water torture. the way she talks so slowly and repeats every other sentence 3 times just makes you want to rip your hair out. terrible class layout on canvas on canvas as well, difficult to find what you need to access. easy class though.
the sweetest woman ever. exams and quizzes were online. a class i looked forward to attending. dr. gerace was very caring and kept lectures entertaining. love love love
didn't give proper guidance to students and was unwilling to answer some questions

she is amazing! she gives lecture notes and study guides to help you succeed. she is super funny and makes the content interesting! she is super easy to connect with; her and the ta's will help you anytime you need them. she offers extra credit which is a nice grade booster. i absolutely recommend her if you have to take an intro psych class!
i don't think he even knows what he's saying half of the time it almost feels like he takes drugs before he teaches us.

you have to buy $150+ course material that doesn't help. he claims that buying the course pack is optional, but literally everything is in it, so you need it. if you ask him a question, he'll confuse you even more to try to get you to understand it yourself. the study guides are very similar to the exams, but it doesn't cover everything, so study.

he was okay but i didn't like his grading scale, if you fail one quiz you're cooked and sometimes when you ask him questions it felt like he was talking down to you. the only thing that helped me were the gsgs so go to them pls.

i thought dr. pearson was great! if you come to class and genuinely listen to what he has to say and read the textbook you will do great on exams. he is very old schooled kind of a professor in a way of just takes notes and read textbook. he has very enjoyable lectures and i think it was a pretty laid back class. no homework either
he not that good, but he really not that bad. 7/10, u just have to try really damn hard cuz he doesn't give much resources other than old tests.

in all 19 years of my life, i have never experienced a class with a structure this horrendous. it is truly remarkable how you can take such an easy topic like stats and make it this difficult and time consuming. the online zoom classes are a complete waste of time, she doesn't teach you anything and you are basically left to teach it to yourself.

she is a horrible professor. we spend most of the classes learning math when most of the exam is conceptual. you need to read the textbook to do well in this class. the class has many top hat questions so thats your "attendance". she is unclear when you ask questions and does not know the answer most of the time. do not take her.

absolutely loved her, she genuinely cares about her students and their learning. she always makes lectures interesting and engaging, telling stories from her personal life, and her time as a crisis counselor as well as her time as a professor. 100% recommend taking psych100 with her, exams are online on canvas.

this class is so incredibly easy but the teacher is awful. she is not helpful in the slightest and booked me for an academic integrity violation that i'm not even guilty of. she has probably been teaching this class for 50 years and still teaches like it's the 50s. i haven't learned any useful information but still take this class it's easy.
